instruction: How were machine learning models used in the analysis of kidney electrolyte measurements investigating the effects of lithium on renal function in an animal model?
Output: Investigating the effects of lithium on renal function in an animal model, machine learning models were used in the analysis of kidney electrolyte measurements. Specifically, principal components analysis (PCA), radial visualization, and random forest classification were performed on the laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) spectra of the kidneys. These machine learning techniques were used for multi-element prediction and classification of the kidney electrolyte levels. Additionally, partial least squares regression was employed to show that standard clinical measurements, such as blood tests, can be used to predict kidney electrolyte measurements, which are typically not feasible to perform in humans. Overall, the use of machine learning analysis, in combination with LIBS, has the potential to improve the clinical management of renal side-effects in patients on lithium medication.
